Thecurrent is supplied to the armature through a  5  armature through a commutator andbrushes.  Ciri-ciri  Tiap Tipe Motor Listrik  6  Ciri-ciri  Tiap Tipe Motor Listrik     In the alternating-current inductionmotor, the currents inthe rotor are supplied byinduction. The rotor’sconductors are cut bythe stators’ alternatingmagnetic field (set up by the alternating - current  7  the alternating - current supply to the fields),which inducesalternating current inthe armatureconductors.  Ciri-ciri  Tiap Tipe Motor Listrik  8

Ciri-ciri  Tiap Tipe Motor Listrik  9  RotorRotor  - Induction motor Two types of rotors are used in induction motors: => squirrel cage rotor and wound rotor. A squirrel-cage rotor consists of thick conducting bars embedded in parallel slots. These bars are short-circuited at both ends by means of short-circuiting rings. A wound rotor has three - phase, double - layer, distributed winding. It is A wound rotor has three - phase, double - layer, distributed winding. It is wound for as many poles as the stator. The three phases are wyed internally and the other ends are connected to slip-rings mounted on a shaft with brushes resting on them. - Synchronous motor – The main difference between the synchronous motor and the induction motor is that the rotor of the synchronous motor travels at the same speed as the rotating magnetic field. This is possible because the magnetic field of the rotor is no longer induced. The rotor either has permanent magnets or DC-excited currents, which are forced to lock into a certain position when confronted with another magnetic field.  Ciri-ciri  Tiap Tipe Motor Listrik  10  StatorStator  - Induction motor – The stator is made up of a number of stampings with slots to carry three phase windings. It is wound for a definite number of poles. The windings are geometrically spaced 120 degrees apart. -   Synchronous motor   –   The stator produces a rotating magnetic field that is -   Synchronous motor   –   The stator produces a rotating magnetic field that is proportional to the frequency supplied.  SHAFT  END SHIELD ROTORSTATOR CORE WINDINGS STATIONARY SWITCH  Konstruksi Motor Listrik  11  RIGID BASE SHAFT BALL BEARINGCENTRIFIGAL ACTUATOR ENCLOSURE  Komponen Motor Listrik  12  Komponen Motor Listrik  13  Komponen Motor Listrik     Frame - The frame is a housing that holds all internal and external motor components.     External Fan - Positioned on the exterior end of the motor assembly, the fan blows air across the outside of the motor     Cast Rotor – Also know of as the armature. The armature is the assembly of windings. These windings interact with the stator to form the magnetic fields necessary for generating rotation energy.  14  across the outside of the motor  to prevent overheating.     Fan Cover – Protects the fan from foreign object damage and protects people from injury.     Front Bearing – Shaft support that reduces friction rotation. The front bearing is located at the end where the shaft extends from the motor housing. rotation energy.     End Ring – Located at the end of the rotor assembly, the end rings provide a surface to connect the rotor bars.     Stator – Stationary portion of the motor’s electrical field. Komponen Motor Listrik     Rear Bearing - Shaft support that reduces friction rotation. The rear bearing is located at the same end as the external cooling fan.     Base – Also referred to as the foot mount, the base secures     Front End Shield – Located at the end where the shaft extends from the motor, the front end shield encloses the motor frame and supports the front bearing.     Rear End Shield – Located at the same end as the external  15  foot mount, the base secures  the motor housing to the equipment platform.     Shaft – The shaft runs longitudinally through the center of the stator, and is supported by the front and rear bearings.    the same end as the external  cooling fan, the rear end shield encloses the motor frame and supports the rear bearing.     Internal Fan – Located within the motor housing, the internal fan circulates air internally Komponen Motor Listrik     Capacitor – Affixed to the outside of the motor, the capacitor shifts the phase of the incoming current and feeds the starter winding.     Nameplate – A tag affixed to the motor to designate motor the motor to designate motor specification parameters.     Connection Box – A box affixed to the motor housing where motor connections are made with the power supply.

Komponen Motor Listrik  ROTOR  END SHIELDS end bell/bracket/end frames STATOR  BEARINGS There are two types of bearings in general use in fractional horsepowermotors. A   ball bearing   is used in motors subject to high thrust or axial loads.Ball bearings cannot be relubricated.  The normal lubricant is grease.Farm duty motors use a grease with low-temperature propertiesbecause most of the motors are subject to extreme low ambient temperature.  18  temperature.  A   sleeve bearing   is used in motors subject to moderate thrust or axialloads.  This includes many of the applications we are familiar with.Sleeve bearings are considered less noisy, but with the quantity oftoday’s ball bearings, the noise difference in most applications isminimal.  Sleeve bearings can usually be relubricated.  Stator Windings     Comprised of turns of copper wire that form a coil.     The coils are placed in the slots of the core and separated from one another and the core by insulation. The coils are then connected to  19     The coils are then connected to  form a phase.  3 Phase, 4 Pole Winding Diagram  20  The Revolving Field  21     Three independent currents flow in a three phase induction motor.     The currents are displaced from each other by exactly 120 electrical degrees.  Theory of Operation     The conversion of electrical energy into mechanical energy takes place in the rotor. The conversion of power is transferred across the air gap inductively. The relative motion between the revolving field and the rotor causes the rotor bars to be cut by the lines  22  the rotor causes the rotor bars to be cut by the lines  of flux. This generates a rotor voltage causing current to flow in the rotor. The rotor then rotates due to the developed torque. The difference between the revolving field and the rotor speed is called slip.  Theory of Operation  23     Alternating   current   =>   arus   bolak-balik   =>   secara   interval   waktu tetap berubah di satu titik positive dan negative.     Medan magnit putar dibuat => membuat tenaga 3 phase.     Stator didihubungkan sumber tenaga listrik 3 phase, masing2 dibuat terpisah   pada   sirkuit   yang   sama.   Satu   putaran   =   360   derajat, sehingga   masing 2   phase   dibuat   berbeda   120   derajat . Alternating Current –AC  24  sehingga   masing 2   phase   dibuat   berbeda   120   derajat .     Gambar dibawah ini menggambarkan kurva sinus.  Listrik 3 phase   Gerak putaran

Stator dan rotor berinteraksi => motor dapat berputar. Untuk memperlihatkan gerakan secara jelas, rotor kita gantikan dengan magnit batangan. Rotor berputar bebas karena pengaruh medan putar dari stator. Gambar motor listrik 2 kutub 3 phase. Phase dihubungkan berpasangan seperti motor sebenarnya : phase   1   terdiri   dari   A 1   dan   A 2 Perubahan kutub  25     phase   1   terdiri   dari   A 1   dan   A 2    phase 2 terdiri dari B1 dan B2     phase 3 terdiri dari C1 dan C2  Rotating magnit field dalam Gerakan putaran lambat     Phase winding / kumparan A,B dan C disusun berbeda 120 derajat. Jumlah kutub ditentukan oleh jumlah winding dipasang perphase, jika winding itu dua maka motor itu berarti motor 2 kutub, demikian juga bila 4 winding itu motor 4 kutub.     Ketika   arus   listrik   dialirkan   ke   motor   putaran   masing2   motor   tentu berbeda - beda   sesuai   dengan   jumlah   kutub . Aplikasi AC Motor  26  berbeda - beda   sesuai   dengan   jumlah   kutub .     Medan magnit putar  Rotating Magnetic Field  27  3 phase, 2 kutub motor   3 phase 8 kutub motor     didepan   kita   menggambarkan   rotor   dengan   menggunakan   magnit permanen, yang berputar didalam stator.     Sebetulnya   dalam   prakteknya   rotor   tidak   menggunakan   magnit biasa.   Analog   dari   stator   sama   terhadap   rotor,   yaitu   menggunakan medan   magnit   yang   di-induksi   dari   stator   ke   konduktor   bar   rotor, sehingga   terjadi   polarisasi   rotor .  Induksi magnet  28  sehingga   terjadi   polarisasi   rotor .  Ketika stator dialiri arus, menimbulkan medan magnit dan memotong  konduktor rotor dan menginduksi arus rotor     Rotating stator flux ditimbulkan oleh medan putar magnit stator     yang dibentuk oleh arus listrik dari tiap phase Rotating Magnetic Field  29  Atraksi  magnit kutub utara rotor terhadap kutub selatan stator dan  menghasilkan kekuatan kopel antara stator dan rotor. MCSA – Motor Current Signature Analysis Limit Aplikasi MCSA :     Harus mengakses panel listrik     Ammeter dihubungkan kabel listrik  33  kabel listrik     Membutuhkan electrician untuk membantu     Survey:     Hanya 10% keruskan motor disebabkan oleh rotor problems  MCSA – Motor Current Signature Analysis  34  Parameter tingkat kerusakan rotor     Fr = motor rotational frequency LSB1 = lower slip sideband of line frequency Lf = line frequency NP = number of poles SF = slip frequency  35  SF = slip frequency     LSB1 = Lf - (NP * SF)  Parameter tingkat kerusakan rotor     Selisih dB amplitude antara LF dan LSB1     54 dB - Kondisi motor normal.     45- 54 dB - Kondisi motor adalah marginal condition     40 -   45 dB -   Setidaknya satu broken rotor bar dapat  36     40 -   45 dB -   Setidaknya satu broken rotor bar dapat  ditemukan (lakukan trending dan monitor terus)     <40 dB - Lebih dari satu broken rotor bar. Route Management Dan AnalyzerRoute Management Dan Analyzer Data TransferData Transfer RBMwareRBMware  59  TujuanTujuan     Mengetahui cara  pembuatan route dengan Route Management.     Mengetahui cara mengedit route yang telah dibuat dengan Route Management.     Mengetahui cara penggunaan Analyzer Data Transfer untuk transfer data dari RBMware ke CSI 2120 atau sebaliknya.  60 60  MembuatMembuat RouteRoute  61     Aktifkan program RBMware.     Setelah program RBMware aktif, pilihlah  File>Open Database .  •   Pilihlah database   rotor bar analysis.rbm   kemudian tekan tombol   OK . •   Kemudian klik ikon   Route Management .  MembuatMembuat RouteRoute  62     Setelah masuk ke program ROUTE pilihlah  CREATE A New Rout e.  •   Pilih area MCC1, kemudian tekan tombol  OK .  MembuatMembuat RouteRoute  63     Pada Route Description isilah dengan MotorCurrent.     Pada Route Creator isilah dengan nama pembuat route.  •   Pindahlah ke bagian Technology Flags, pilihlah Include Motor Points. •   Kemudian tekan tombol  OK .  MembuatMembuat RouteRoute  64     Setelah itu pilihlah equipment WCP#1 dengan menekan tombol   OK .  •   Kemudian tekan tombol  Update Route   untuk menulis route yang telah dibuat ke database.

MembuatMembuat RouteRoute  65     Setelah muncul tampilan utama program ROUTE, buatlah route untuk area MCC2.     Pada Route Description isilah dengan MotorFlux. isilah dengan MotorFlux.     Pindahlah ke bagian Technology Flags, pilihlah Include Motor Points.  MengeditMengedit RouteRoute  66     Pilih   Edit An Existing Route.     Sorot pada route Motor Current, kemudian tekan tombol   Route Info .  •   Akan muncul informasi mengenai route tersebut. •   Tekan tombol   OK   untuk kembali ke tampilan awal.  MengeditMengedit RouteRoute  67     Pilih kembali route Motor Current dan tekan tombol  OK   untuk mengedit route tersebut .  •   Untuk menambah equipment pada route Motor Current pilih Add New Equipment To Route kemudian tekan tombol OK.  MengeditMengedit RouteRoute  68     Pilih equipment WCP#2 kemudian tekan tombol   OK . •   Hasilnya bisa dicek dengan memilih route Motor Current, kemudian tekan tombol   Route Info .  MenggunakanMenggunakan Analyzer Data TransferAnalyzer Data Transfer  69     Untuk masuk ke program Analyzer Data Transfer klik ikonnya pada tampilan utama program RBMware. •   Pilih Setup Comm untuk mengubah konfigurasi port komunikasi.  MenggunakanMenggunakan Analyzer Data TransferAnalyzer Data Transfer  70     Sesuaikan nomor Communication Port sesuai dengan port yang akan digunakan pada komputer. •   Samakan pilihan Stop Bit Selection, Baud Rate Selection, Number of Retries dan Timeout Delay dengan setting di CSI 2120.  MenggunakanMenggunakan Analyzer Data TransferAnalyzer Data Transfer  71     Untuk kembali ke tampilan utama program CSICOM tekan tombol   OK   setelah selesai mengonfigurasi port komunikasi. •   Kemudian tekan tombol   Initiate  untuk memulai komunikasi dengan CSI 2120. •   Perintah download/upload data dilakukan melalui CSI 2120. RPS =  11.87 50   52   54   56   58   60   62   64   66   68   70 0 10 20 30 40 Frequency in Hz d B A M P  Application of MCSA, flux coil for Electrical Motor     Using Flux to Analyze Motor Problems     Flux Analysis for Rotor Faults     Flux Analysis for Stator Faults     Unbalance Voltage Supply     Shorted Winding Turn     Shorted rotor lamination  83  Motor  Condition Monitoring (Part 3)     Shorted rotor lamination     Phasing problem  Diagnosing Rotor Bar Problems.     The life of a rotor is directly proportional to the number of starts and stops of a motor.     To diagnose rotor problems with flux we capture a baseline current reading to normalize flux measurements.  84  measurements.     Then we trend the flux measurement and look for side bands of  (slip frequency X #poles) about Line Frequency.  Flux MonitoringFlux Monitoring   Use 343 Flux Coil   Position on the fan shroud of a motor   Measures magnetic flux signature of AC induction motors   Detects  85   Detects $   - rotor bar faults  $   - stator faults  $   - unbalanced voltage  $   - motor speed  FLUX NotesFLUX Notes   Do not need to know load   Do not need to know # of bars   Do not need to know # of stator slots   Need to position coil consistently  86   Need to position coil consistently   Need MCSA baseline FLUX Benefits     Detects same faults as motor current and more     without accessing electric panels     without connecting to live power leads     without requiring an electrician during vibration route collection  87     during vibration route collection  Using Flux to Analyze Motor Problems  88

Menggunakan Rotor Bar AnalysisRotor Bar Analysis  113  •   Pilih alarm option •   Masukan angka-angka alarm standard. •   Pilih   Time   pada   Unit for Time Axis  •   Pilih   yes   pada   Mark Normalizing Frequency  Menggunakan Rotor Bar AnalysisRotor Bar Analysis  114  •   Dari data terihat Confidence = 94 % dan estimated Broken Bar = 0,6. •   Disimpulkan bahwa motor dalam kondisi baik  Menggunakan Rotor Bar AnalysisRotor Bar Analysis  115  •   Pilih Equipment yang lain •   Pada summary terlihat bahwa estimated Broken Bar adalah 5,4 dengan kepercayaan 43 %. •   kemungkinan ada bar yang patah  Menggunakan Rotor Bar AnalysisRotor Bar Analysis  116  Hasil pengukuran di area yang lain (pada stator) terlihat bahwa tidak ada sideband di sekitar Line Frekuensi  Menggunakan Rotor Bar AnalysisRotor Bar Analysis  117  Pada equipment yang lain terlihat bahwa ada sideband di sekitar line frequensi Dengan tingkat kepercayaan 43 % kemungkinan ada bar yang patah  Flux Coil Analysis  118  Sinyal – Sinyal Hasil Pengukuran Flux Coil  119  •   Sinyal kondisi normal. •   Garis putus-putus mengindikasikan NPxSF sideband di sekitar line frequensi •   Peak yang disilang adalah runing speed di sekitar line frequensi.  Sinyal – Sinyal Hasil Pengukuran Flux Coil  120  Sinyal yang diakibatkan oleh ketidakbenaran penempatan alat ukur sehingga terpengaruh oleh vibrasi

Unbalance Voltage Supply  121  Spektrum flux 50 HP motor dengan 0% unbalance  Spektrum flux 50 HP motor dengan 3% unbalance  Unbalance Voltage Supply  122  Hasil perbandingan spektrum flux  Shorted Winding Turn  123  Motor 50 HP dengan stator dalam kondisi baik  Motor 50 HP dengan short pada stator winding  Shorted Winding Turn  124  Perbandingan antara 2 spektrum yang dihasilkan  Memilih Motor Analsis Option  125  Pilih flux coil analysis pada Analysis Type Pada analysis Option •   Flux Evaluation dipilih   Low Frequency  •   lalu pilih   spectrum   pada plot to display •   Measurement Point adalah   RB1  Memilih Motor Analsis Option  126  Dalam Display Option klik yes pada Mark SlipxPoles Sideband, Abbreviated high flux summary serta wave form, lalu klik   OK  Pada Waveform pilih Time untuk tima axis, serta yes untuk Mark normalizing freq dan grid lines on plot, lalu klik  OK  Memilih Motor Analsis Option  127  Muncul plot yang siap dianalisis  Terima Kasih End 128
